result.execSummary:
The defendant Pai Chang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign appropriate releases so agent can monitor compliance. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
5 days conditional jail - granted huber privileges and if approved by the jail can serve 1/2 of the sentence on GPS electronic home monitor.
Report to jail today for start date.
60 days to commence jail sentence.

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Comply with same conditions as Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular

records.addlTxt: Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 11/07/16 at 3:30 pm

Defendant Pai Chang in court with attorney Robert A Gardner. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:49 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

State files an Amended Information to Amend Count 1.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 1-3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Gardner makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent 
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay $50 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
5 days conditional jail - granted huber priveleges and if approved by the jail can serve 1/2 of the sentence on GPS electronic home monitor
Report to jail today for start date
60 days to commence jail sentence
20 hours of community service
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign appropriate releases so agent can monitor compliance. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide a DNA sample 

Count 2 -

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *2 times per week.
***Stip & Order 11-01-2016: Ameneded Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *1 times per week.***
Day report reduced to 1 time per week.
